case_vignette: On day-of-life 2, a 3-day-old boy who was born with no visible skin problems begins to develop erosions and bullae over both the palmar and plantar surfaces! These bullae are localized to areas of friction or trauma (eg, where electrocardiogram leads were placed)! The mother’s pregnancy was normal, and the infant had been born without complications! Aside from the development of bullae, the infant has no evidence of any other medical problems! The infant’s parents are healthy and have no medical problems! No one in the infant’s family has had similar dermatologic findings!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have developed erosions and blisters on the surfaces of my palms and soles.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms since day 2 of my life.
Do you have any other skin lesions on different parts of the body?
No, I do not have any other skin lesions on different parts of the body.
Do you have any family members with similar symptoms or skin conditions?
No, no one in my family has had similar skin conditions or symptoms.
Have you been diagnosed with any other medical conditions since birth or currently taking any medications?
No, I have no evidence of any other medical problems and am not taking any medications.
Final Diagnosis: Epidermolysis Bullosa Simplex

The patient reports no other skin lesions on different parts of the body. There is no known family history of similar skin conditions or symptoms. Additionally, the patient has no evidence of other medical problems and is not on any medications.
